text: Ludmila Vaňková (27 May 1927 – 3 February 2022) was a Czech writer. She was born in Prague. She was known for writing Lev a růže tetralogyPavel Janoušek. "Vaňková. Ludmila Smithová". Slovník českých spisovatelů od roku 1945. Brána. 1998. Part 2. Page 600. Google Books. (English: The Lion and the Rose).V Ambros, "Czech women writers after 1945" in Hawkesworth (ed), A History of Central European Women's Writing, Palgrave Macmillan, 2001, Springer This was made up of four novels (Král železný, král zlatý, Zlá léta, Dědicové zlatého krále, Žebrák se stříbrnou holí). Vaňková died in February 2022 in Prague, at the age of 94. ==References== Category:1927 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Writers from Prague
